channel.title: Thingiverse - Newest Things
channel.description: The newest and coolest things from Thingiverse.com

item.title: Brake fluid funnel for Tektro Hydraulic brakes
item.description: I made this to screw into the fill screw on the handles of Tektro hydraulic brakes. I did 40% fill, but I think you can get away with any settings as long as the threads print.
item.author: jadenmart

item.title: Helicopter Automaton
item.description:
Summary Section: The project replicates the movement of a helicopter as it flies in the air using 3D Automation. The Helicopter rotor spins as the person turns the handle as well as moves up and down. The overall dimensions of the project are 20 cm x 8 cm x 16 cm.

This automaton was a lot of fun to design and assemble. After building the first revision of the assembly, I realized that there were many different ways that to change the assembly such as customizing the look of the helicopter as well as changing up the colors so that it looked more appealing. Through creating this project, I significantly improved my Solidworks skills as well as approach to design. If you want a cool automaton that uses rotational cams to show off to your friends and family, I am sure that our helicopter will not disappoint :).

Building this helicopter automaton was a team project. I worked with Nivia Wilson to plan, sketch, create, and assemble this automaton.
Here is a link to Nivia’s page:
item.author: snalatwad2022

item.author: Alankam58

item.title: TFV16 / TFV18 Tank (Glass)
item.description: i got tired of having to buy the glasses and they key breaking. Since then after i made my own its been dropped / thrown / ran over no leaks no cracks and is still helping me chug the vape around...should be right on spot if not stop when the first ring is printed and if to small increase by 5% some printers and slicers are different so if unsure test it when you get that far to avoid waste donate if your feeling nice
item.author: Semmons91

item.title: Vase #625
item.description:
This vase can be printed in vase mode or spiralize outer contour in cura, or printed in normal mode. You can uncheck spiralize outer contour for normal mode, set top layers to 0, set infill to 0%. Bottom layers set to 3 or more. Set walls to 1 or 2 or more for a more sturdy vase if not in vase mode. Can be scaled to fit your needs. The vase in the photo shows vase not scaled at 100% of the stl file at 84mm wide for X and Y and Z is 110mm tall. It has not been tested for being watertight and probably isn't printed in vase mode. If you make it, please post a photo, I'd like to see your print!
Enjoy...

(Notes below...... :)
item.author: _Steve

item.title: Rancilio Silvia drip tray float
item.description:
For Rancilio Silvia coffee machines, this is a water level indicator to alert you when the drip tray is full or nearly full.

It is designed to remain attached to the drip tray cover but can be easily removed as needed.

The duct is designed to be pushed tightly into any of the holes on a Rancilio Silvia drip tray cover. Avoid the first row so you leave enough room for the float not to hit the side.

The float is largely hollow to ensure it actually floats.
item.author: Time_has_come

item.title: LGV60 Dual Screen Dock with Mag
item.description:
I wanted something to slip my LG V60 with the Dual Screen in and automatically connect to my android auto deck in my car. This works great for me on my 08 Subaru Impreza, but I made it so that you can place it in other vehicles or locations.

This is a work in progress and if I update it, I shall include updates (obviously lol)

I used eSun PLA+ for now until I make an enclosure for ASA prints, which I recommend for long term life in vehicles or the outdoors.

This is in 3 parts

1st is the main body which hold the phone

2nd is the bottom piece which inserts into the main body and houses the magnetic usb c adapter

3rd is the clip

The reason for the 3 pieces is so you can add insulation to prevent scratches to your phone (last one made by LG!) and to cushion the bottom of the phone and the clip so it can be glued anywhere of your choosing.

And yes, all parts are glued. I recommend Loctite Super Glue (blue bottle). Any cyanoacrylate should be fine, but I find this particular one to make PLA pieces forever into one without any issues.

For insulation, I used toolbox drawer liner from Harbor Freight.

ONLY LINE THE BOTTOM PIECE FACING THE PHONE AND 3 SIDES IN THE BODY!!!

Using it on all 4 sides results in the phone being too tight in the dock.
Any insulation of your choosing can be used, so long that its 1.5MM thick or thinner.

Please, remix this to your hearts content and I hope to improve this later on with a more modular one for other phones. I shall include some pictures of it in my car once the sun is up.
item.author: john_talroc

item.title: PCB holder frame - Triangle
item.description:
Takes 4 M8 nuts, two M8 bolt of whatever length you like (as long as it's larger than 30mm or so, and two segments of 1/2 inches PVC pipe wahtever length.

Print two of these and join them together. Two nuts on each triangle, bolt through them inward, put a M8 PCB holder cap of your choice on the end, slide both frames onto tube, clamp.
item.author: KeyboardPrinter

item.title: Pooh Cookie cutter
item.description: 2 part cookie cutter for easier use.
item.author: omarelc

item.title: TinyHawk 2 Freestyle silicone insta360 go camera mount
item.description:
It works great, and it is much more durable than pla or tpu.
To make it print the mold, then mix type 1 silicon (the acetic one) with about 10 drops of food coloring.
Next step is kind of optinal, depending of what you want the final product to be; if you want a really soft and flexible mount, skip this step, otherwise add like 1 teaspoon of cornstarch to the silicone and mix it good. (I prefer a less flexible mount so it doesnt mess with my pid tune, so I add the cornstarch).
Mix it all very good (the more the better, as later it wont stain everything with little food coloring droplets).
Using a bbq stick or something like that (not your hands unless you want stain them for a week, and i find it really difficult to work this sticky mixture using gloves) put the mix into the mold and try tu pump it and pressure it into the mold.
After you do both halves, I usualy add a little extra silicone in the middle to make sure both parts meke contact and close the mold.
Try to pressure more mixture throught the open face and when you feel its full, add some more cornstarch and make the open face flat using a desk or something.
Let dry for at least 24 hours and to demold just crack the mold in the seem and peel away the silicone.
I sugest washing it in running water to remove extra food coloring.
To install it on the drone use some kind of washer. I have used plastic from a bottle and aluminum from a beer can.
Thats it!
Good flying
item.author: matimolfino

item.title: Filter Cone Holder
item.description:
The old way to store this filter cone, was a simple hook.
Now it's much better, the 3D printed way.

item.title: Ver1:CRUX35_Insta360GO_Mount_Vertical (20deg.)
item.description:
This mount is used to attach the Insta360GO to the CRUX35.
This is a vertical type.
It's tilted 20 degrees from vertical.

It is for tough PLA, so it is a bit large.
Slide Insta360go into this mount and secure it with a rubber band.
This is based on data from My_Room, thank you!
item.author: mmh2022

item.title: 1/8th cup Dog Food Scoop
item.description:
My family had a hard time feeding our small dogs the correct amount of food at breakfast and dinner so I made a scoop for the correct amount of food. In our case it is 1/8th of a cup.

I used tree support and a roof on the support to break it out easier and it did pop out.

I did the calculations to make sure I was at 1/8th cup. Works great for kibble, probably not accurate enough for liquids.
item.author: bontexx

item.title: My First 3D Model
item.description:

Made with TinkerCAD, it's simple but it's mine and I'm pleased I managed to make something at all

item.title: Silicone Bed Mount Spacer
item.description: Some of the silicone bed mounts spacers you purchase do not come with a shorter spacer to accommodate the bracket for the heated bed cables on the Ender 3 series. I created these spacers so the height is even in all four corners for more even leveling.

item.author: astroukulele

item.title: 4S Battery Pack
item.description:
EDIT: This is a work in progress. Things will be added or changed.

The purpose of this design was to make the battery pack reusable. When the batteries wear out I want to be able to easily replace them and continue using the pack.

This 4S cell battery pack meant to supply around 12 volts or be used in place of a vehicle battery. The battery trays can be used individually to wire together as many batteries as you want. I use the battery pack to rapid charge my phone, charge a dead car battery enough to start it or anything that can use 10 - 14vdc. It uses a JST-XH balance connector for balance charging the pack on a RC hobby charger. I used the LFP26650EV LiFePO4 batteries from K2 energy. Everything is designed to be fairly easy to print.

Print Settings:
Battery Tray
Material - ASA
Layer height - 0.2mm
Line Width - 0.4mm
Nozzle Temp - 240C
Bed - 110C
Print Speed - 25mm\s
Bed Adhesion - ASA Juice (10g ASA p/ 100ml Acetone)

Battery Pack Body
Material - ASA
Layer height - 0.2mm
Line Width - 0.4mm
Nozzle Temp - 240C
Bed - 110C
Print Speed - 30mm\s
Bed Adhesion - ASA Juice (10g ASA p/ 100ml Acetone)

Battery Pack Cap
Material - ASA
Layer height - 0.2mm
Line Width - 0.4mm
Nozzle Temp - 240C
Bed - 110C
Print Speed - 20mm\s
Bed Adhesion - ASA Juice (10g ASA p/ 100ml Acetone)

Construction Notes:
1st. - Print all the necessary pieces. 2 battery trays, a battery pack body and a battery pack cap.

2nd. - Assemble the battery trays. Refer to the pictures if necessary.
 a. - Solder together the contacts as shown in the pictures. I add wires for the balance connectors now because it's easier than doing it when everything is assembled.
 b. - Glue together the two battery trays back-to-back. One side should be flat and one side should have two holes through it. Make sure not to get glue in the slots for the battery contacts or they may not slide in on the next step.
 c. - Slide in and glue the battery contacts in place.

3rd. - Put the battery tray in the body and solder all the wires in. I used this wire as the main hookup wire to the battery and a dean's connector. You can use any connector you would like. I included this page as a reference to how balance connectors are wired. Additionally, the pictures can be used as a reference.

4th. - Screw the cap on. The holes should fit #4 or M2.6 fasteners. The screws in the picture I ordered from McMaster.
item.author: Murphse

item.title: SteelSeries Arctis Pro Wireless Gaming Headset Speaker Plate Personalization Reference
item.description:
I recreated the headphone cup caps (they may be called “Speaker Plates” for my SteelSeries Arctis Pro Wireless. It maybe be possible to FDM print these with a 0.4 mm nozzle, but I have not attempted it yet. I just wanted to try and recreate something very close to the originals so that I could use them as reference going forward.

It is advisable to print these with something smaller than a 0.4 mm nozzle if you have it available, or attempt it with a resin printer. Better yet remix it using some of the dimensions that you can pull from the mesh and create a version that is optimized for FDM or whatever other form or 3D printing you prefer.

I have not found any magnets that could be used in conjunction with this model to fully recreate the speaker plates, but I will update the listing when/if I do.
item.author: Ostella3d

item.author: Halliwax

item.title: Ford Maverick Under Seat Space Divider
item.description:
Divider for the under rear seat storage of a 2022 Ford Maverick.

3D print the Slot Tee and add whatever divider material you have handy, I used a scrap of 1/8" MDF.

My FITS Tee is sized for an 8-32 screw and hex nut.
item.author: thepete2112

item.title: Vertical Bar Soap Holder
item.description: I needed something to hold my bar soap that I use when I come in from working in my shop. It needed to be narrow, and drain the water off the soap into the sink. This is what I came up with. I hope you like it. There is a video on the Bontexx youtube channel.
item.author: bontexx

item.title: Spool holder for Ender3 v2 and other
item.description:
Hello everyone. My English is not very good. So I apologize if I misspell. I am using Ender3 v2. The filament spool holder of this one is a little small. Sometimes noises occur when I insert a spool of filament. I feel the need to constantly check the printer to the left of these sounds. That's why I made this spool holder. There are 2 versions here. One without adapter, the other with adapter. Personally, I use the one without adapter and I am satisfied. The nut is compatible with both versions. I haven't tested the one with the adapter. Here I am sharing the Fusion 360 files. Please check again before printing.

V1 (without adapter) are 3 parts,
V2 (with adapter) are 4 parts.

The nut is compatible with both.

I preferred to use PETG instead of PLA.

Herkese merhaba. Arkadaşlar ben Ender3 v2 kullanıyorum. Bunun filament makara tutacağı biraz küçük. Filament makarası taktığım zaman bazen sesler oluyor. Bu seslerden dolayı sürekli yazıcıyı kontrol etme gereği duyuyorum.Bu yüzden bu makara tutacağını yaptım. Burada 2 versiyon bulunuyor. Bir tanesi adaptörlü, diğeri adaptörsüz. Şahsen ben adaptörsüz olanı kullanıyorum ve memnunum. Somun her iki versiyona uyumlu. Adaptörlü olanını test etmedim. Burada Fusion 360 dosyalarını paylaşıyorum. Lütfen baskı yapmadan önce tekrar kontrol edin.

V1 olan parçalar adaptörsüz 3 parça, V2 olan parçalar adaptörlü 4 parça. Somun her ikisinede uyumlu.

Ben PLA yerine PETG kullanmayı tercih ettim.
item.author: Falke42

item.title: N-scale car - Sony HDR-AZ1 action cam
item.description:
An N-scale car, designed with a well for the camera to sit in, so that it'll better fit in tunnels or other low-clearance spaces.

Designed to hold the Sony HDR-AZ1 action cam.

Video of car/camera in action: https://www.facebook.com/100017962336283/videos/305349441637449

Truck mounts have a hole, but may need to bored out a bit depending on the size of the bolster pins you use. We installed Microtrains passenger trucks on it for extra stability.

Print top-down, and no supports are required.
item.author: pbechard

item.title: Porta Canetas do Flamengo
item.description:
Porta canetas do Flamengo

Nas fotos esse portas canetas foi modificado colocando o nome da pessoa que ia
ganhar de presente.

Esse porta canetas não foi pintado, ele foi impresso utilizando 3 filamentos de cores diferente e trocando o filamento durante a impressão para a cor apropriada.

Não precisa de suportes.

Imprima ele na orientação em que está ( com as costa na mesa ).

Espero que gostem.
